# DEPARTMENT OF STATE TELEGRAM
**UNCLASSIFIED**

::: {.cable-meta}
:::


1. TEXACO AND YPFB SIGNED OPEATIONS CONTRACT ON MAY 2, 1974.
TEXACO TO EXPLORE 1,040,000 HECTARES LOCATED IN BENI DEPARTMENT
ROUGHLY WITHIN 13 DEGREES 40 MINUTES AND 15 DEGREES 15 MINUTES
LATITUDE AND 66 DEGREES 15 MINUTES AND 67 DEGREES 30 MINUTES
LONGITUDE


2. TEXACO TO RECEIVE 44 PER CENT OF PETROLEUM PRODUCTION UP TO
100,000 BARRELS/DAY AND 43 PERCENT OF PRODUCTION EXCEEDING 100,000
BBLS/DAY. OF NATURAL GAS TEXACO TO RECEIVE 44 PERCENT UP TO
200,000,000 CUBIC FEET/DAY AND 43 PER CENT OF GAS PRODUCTION
EXCEEDING 200,000,000 CUBIC FEET/DAY


3. TEXACO MUST INVEST MINIMUM OF U.S. $4.5 MILLION IN FIRST THREE
YEARS.


4. COMMENT: UNION OIL'S CONTRACT PERMITTED UNION TO RECEIVE
50 PER CENT OF PETROLEUM FOUND. TEXACO PRESENTLY BEING LAST
COMPANY TO SIGN ONLY RECEIVES 44 PERCENT. TEXACO ALSO MUST INVEST




 311717Z


ABOUT US$500,000 MORE TAN OTHER OIL COMPANIES IN BOLIVIA IN
EXPLORATION WITHIN NEXT THREE TO FOUR YEARS. EMBOFF TOLD BY




                     

                 

OFFICIAL OF MIN ENERGENCY AND HYDROCARBONS THAT EL PASO NATURAL GAS
DEIDED NOT TO SIGN OPERATION CONTRACT. AT PRESENT EIGHT OPEATION
CONTRACTS HAVE BEEN SIGNED.
BREWIN
